revised_title: Advances in Seismic Recording and Analysis: S-Waves from Small Seismic Sources
tldr: This article discusses recent advancements in the technique of seismic recording and analysis, focusing on S-waves generated by small seismic sources. The author presents field measurements and data processing techniques using a four-element array of three-component seismometers. The results suggest that improvements in wave signal-to-noise ratios are possible, and the method offers promise for identifying small seismic events.
